sn54.4:4.1: “Mendicants, when mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.4:4.2: And how is mindfulness of breathing developed and cultivated to be very fruitful and beneficial?
sn54.4:4.3: It’s when a mendicant—gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut—sits down in the meditation posture, with their body erect, and establishes mindfulness right there.
sn54.4:4.4: Ever mindful, they breathe in. Mindful, they breathe out. …
sn54.4:4.5: They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe in observing letting go.’ They practice like this: ‘I’ll breathe out observing letting go.’
sn54.4:4.6: Mindfulness of breathing, when developed and cultivated in this way, is very fruitful and beneficial.
sn54.4:4.7: When mindfulness of breathing is developed and cultivated in this way you can expect one of two results:
sn54.4:4.8: final knowledge in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
